p: The carvacrol (5-isopropyl-2-methylphenol) is a phenolic monoterpene present in EOs of various species especially the Lamiaceae family, which presented pharmacological potentials, such as antioxidant and anti-inflammatory [ 90, 91]. The compound was the most reported in the studies included in this article, exhibiting activity in preclinical models of inflammatory diseases of the gastrointestinal tract, such as chemotherapy-induced mucositis and DMH-induced colitis. Its pharmacological activity in the mentioned models is a result of reduced expression of NF- κB, COX-2, and iNOS, associated with decreased levels of IL-1 β, TNF- α, and NO. The treatment was also able to increase the antioxidant enzymes SOD, CAT, MDA, and GSH [ 47, 51].
